articles.author: Julie Zhu
articles.title: Chinese EV maker Lixiang files for U.S. IPO of at least $500 mln -sources
articles.description: Chinese electric vehicle maker Lixiang Automotive has filed for a U.S. initial public offering, aiming to raise at least $500 million, said two people with direct knowledge of the matter, joining peers seeking to finance growth through stock listings.
articles.content: HONG KONG/BEIJING (Reuters) - Chinese electric vehicle maker Lixiang Automotive has filed for a U.S. initial public offering, aiming to raise at least $500 million, said two people with direct knowledge of the matter, joining peers seeking to finance growth t… [+2350 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: U.S. embassy urges citizens to depart Iraq immediately -statement
articles.description: The United States embassy in Baghdad urged on Friday all citizens to depart Iraq immediately, hours after the U.S. killed Iranian Quds Force leader Qassem Soleimani and Iraqi militia commander Abu Mahdi al-Muhandis in an air strike.
articles.content:
BAGHDAD (Reuters) - The United States embassy in Baghdad urged on Friday all citizens to depart Iraq immediately, hours after the U.S. killed Iranian Quds Force leader Qassem Soleimani and Iraqi militia commander Abu Mahdi al-Muhandis in an air strike. 
“Due… [+343 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: HSBC to stop weekend, overnight services at some Hong Kong ATMs after branches vandalized
articles.description: HSBC <0005.HK> will suspend overnight services at 19 ATM clusters in Hong Kong on weekends and public holidays, the bank said on Friday, two days after its branches and ATMs were targeted during anti-government protests.
articles.content:
HONG KONG (Reuters) - HSBC (HSBA.L) (0005.HK) will suspend overnight services at 19 ATM clusters in Hong Kong on weekends and public holidays, the bank said on Friday, two days after its branches and ATMs were targeted during anti-government protests.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Electric cars rise to record 42.4% market share in Norway in 2019
articles.description: The sale of new electric cars in Norway rose by 30.9% last year amid soaring demand for Tesla Inc's vehicles, but the pioneering U.S. firm faces rising competition from rival auto makers in 2020.
articles.content:
OSLO, Jan 3 (Reuters) - The sale of new electric cars in Norway rose by 30.9% last year amid soaring demand for Tesla Inc’s vehicles, but the pioneering U.S. firm faces rising competition from rival auto makers in 2020. 
Fully electric cars made up 42.4% of … [+277 chars]

articles.author: Mark Gleeson
articles.title: England win toss as Archer misses out on second test
articles.description: England paceman Jofra Archer will miss the second test against South Africa starting on Friday, piling on the misery for the visitors after the overnight announcement of Rory Burns' return home with a tour-ending ankle injury.
articles.content:
CAPE TOWN (Reuters) - England paceman Jofra Archer will miss the second test against South Africa starting on Friday, piling on the misery for the visitors after the overnight announcement of Rory Burns’ return home with a tour-ending ankle injury.

articles.title: German unemployment rises more than expected in December
articles.description: German unemployment rose more than expected in December, data showed on Friday, adding to signs that weakness in the manufacturing sector is hurting the labour market in Europe's biggest economy.
articles.content:
BERLIN (Reuters) - German unemployment rose more than expected in December, data showed on Friday, adding to signs that weakness in the manufacturing sector is hurting the labour market in Europe’s biggest economy.

articles.title: British American Tobacco welcomes FDA flavor ban; minimal impact seen
articles.description: British American Tobacco, the world's No.2 tobacco company, welcomed the U.S. health regulator's move to ban popular e-cigarette flavors, saying it would comply with the new guidelines aimed at curbing teenage vaping.
articles.content:

articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is to cut short his trip to Greece following the assassination of Major-General Qassem Soleimani, head of Iran's Quds Force, said an official in Netanyahu's office.

articles.title: Iraqi civil aviation authority says no delays to fights from Baghdad airport: state TV
articles.description: Iraq's civil aviation authority said on Friday there would be no delays to any flights from Baghdad international airport, state TV reported, hours after the United States carried out an air strike on the airport.
articles.content:
BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Iraq’s civil aviation authority said on Friday there would be no delays to any flights from Baghdad international airport, state TV reported, hours after the United States carried out an air strike on the airport.
